title: Ticket #2025: classad attributes ending in \ or "multi-line" attributes
description:
I had first notice this here:

https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=692852

But it appears to be a general case issue: 

<Gregggg> bash-3.2$ echo 'FOO = "\"' >> /tmp/mach
<Gregggg> bash-3.2$ condor_advertise UPDATE_STARTD_AD /tmp/mach
<Gregggg> couldn't parse ClassAd in /tmp/mach
remarks:
2011-Apr-03 15:43:26 by gthain:
I've pushed a fix to one place which was obviously wrong, but there might very well be other problems -- I would like another set of eyes to look at the Windows Java problem.

2011-Apr-04 10:36:58 by tstclair:
Success!

2011-Apr-04 11:45:11 by tstclair:
Seems related to the compat_classad issue 

From: 	kschwarz@embraer.com.br
Reply-to: 	Condor-Users Mail List <condor-users@cs.wisc.edu>
To: 	condor-users@cs.wisc.edu
Subject: 	[Condor-users] failed to create classad; bad expr = JavaFullversion
Date: 	Thu, 31 Mar 2011 09:52:59 -0300 (03/31/2011 07:52:59 AM)



I am testing Condor 7.5.6 on Linux and are getting the following message in the StarterLog:

03/31 09:48:39 failed to create classad; bad expr = JavaFullversion = "J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.3 Linux amd64-64 j9vmxa64142-20090310 (JIT enabled)

Any way to fix this?

Thanks,
Klaus

----------------------------------
Full line is actually:

JavaFullversion = "J2RE 1.4.2 IBM J9 2.3 Linux amd64-64 j9vmxa64142ifx-20090909 (JIT enabled)
J9VM - 20090908_41946_LHdSMr
JIT  - 20090210_1447ifx1_r8
GC   - 200902_24"

2011-Apr-04 19:36:53 by gthain:
Note that classads (at least the old classads) has no good way to parse a whole classad directly from a file -- all the routines read in a line at a time. So, I think the most expeditious way to fix this is to fix the Java code which is emitting the attributes.
check_ins:
2011-Apr-13 10:30   Check-in [21377]: Recompile CondorJavaInfo.class with -target 1.3 #2025 So that it runs on machines with older Java VMs. (By Greg Thain )
2011-Apr-12 22:59   Check-in [21370]: Prevent CondorJavaInfo from emitting illegal classads #2025 by replacing \n with ' '. (By Greg Thain )
2011-Apr-03 15:40   Check-in [21245]: Fix parsing of trailing backslashes in classads #2025 (By Greg Thain )
creator: tstclair
